header.author: Edmund Chapman
header.title: A reply to Mr. Douglass's Short account of the state of midwifery in London and Westminster. Wherein His trifling and malicious Cavils are answer'd, his Interestedness and Disingenuity impartially represented, and the Practice of Physick, but particularly the Character of the late Dr. Chamberlen, vindicated from his indecent and unjust Aspersions. By Edmund Chapman, Surgeon and Man-Midwife, in Orange-Street, near Red Lion-Square.
